thig3.5:1.1: the phrase "gone beyond life", although implied, is not explicitly present in the text.
thig3.5:1.4: lit. "all with the name J카v훮", or "all named J카v훮"
thig3.5:1.6: There is no phrase "with the same despair" (unless that's how you're translating the prefix 'anu-' on 'anusocasi')
thig3.5:2.1: 'Alas' is an exclamation of regret or despair, whereas here 'vata' seems to be an exclamation of joy, wonderment, or gratitude
thig3.5:2.2: I think 'stuck in the heart' would be better, as it matches the metaphor of 'dart'
thig3.5:2.3: "The sorrow which I was overcome by -
thig3.5:3.1: "Today the dart has been pulled out,"
thig3.5:3.2: "I am free of craving, fully quenched." [Although I dislike translating 'nibbuta' as 'quenched', consistency is of value in these situations.]
thig3.5:3.3: I recommend adding a dash at the end of this phrase.
